description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida heads to Washington looking to strengthen his country’s alliance with the US while sidestepping issues that cast their ties in an unfavorable light — including the planned takeover of United States Steel Corp.
title: Japan’s Kishida Will Look to Sidestep Cracks in Unity With Biden

description: A bipartisan group of US senators urged President Joe Biden to punish Venezuela’s Nicolas Maduro for attacks against his top opposition rival, saying that an upcoming election fails to meet the promise of a free and fair vote.
title: Senators Urge US to Reimpose Sanctions on Venezuela’s Maduro

description: The battlegrounds for South Korea’s parliamentary elections that will determine how much power President Yoon Suk Yeol wields for the rest of his term include the Yongsan district in central Seoul, where he keeps his office.
title: South Korea Election Hinges on Urban Voters and Inflation Worries

description: Former Ecuador Vice President Jorge Glas, who days ago was forcibly removed from the Mexican embassy, is in stable condition in a coma at a Guayaquil military hospital after ingesting prescription medications.
title: Ecuador’s Jailed Ex-Vice President in Coma After Taking Pills

description: Countries from Central Asia to South America are building their own killer tech based on Iranian designs — often with US components.
title: Iran’s Better, Stealthier Drones Are Remaking Global Warfare

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional and politics correspondent Christian Hall looks at the headaches confronting House Speaker Mike Johnson as the House returns to work. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Headaches Ahead for Johnson as House Returns, Ukraine Vote Looms

description: A spiraling dispute over the leadership of Petroleo Brasileiro SA is exposing fault lines in President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s administration, repeatedly roiling markets.
title: Rivalries in Lula’s Cabinet Roil Petrobras and Brazilian Markets

description: Russia seized control of assets of agricultural holding company AgroTerra under a decree aimed at companies from “unfriendly” countries.
title: Russia Takes Control of Agricultural Holding Backed by US Firm

description: Millions of Americans with federal student loans have been making payments again. Given the huge scale of student loan debt in the US — more than 40 million people collectively owe more than $1.6 trillion — there are concerns that discretionary consumer spending will take a hit. The issue is sure to play a role in the 2024 political campaign season, as many young voters fault Republicans and a conservative-majority Supreme Court for stymieing attempts by President Joe Biden, a Democrat, to ease
title: Why Some US Student Loans Are Forgiven But Not Others

description: The socialist government of Venezuela is discussing compensation with at least two Colombian companies whose assets were seized under late President Hugo Chávez.
title: Venezuela Talks With Colombian Firms Over Chavez-Era Asset Seizures

description: West Virginia’s treasurer announced that he is restricting four financial services firms from providing state banking services because he says they “boycott” the fossil fuels industry.
title: West Virginia Bars Citi, HSBC From Banking Contracts Over Oil

description: The Air Force reduced budget projections for its next-generation stealth bomber, Northrop Grumman Corp.’s B-21 Raider, by under $2 billion over the next two fiscal years thanks in part to lower prices negotiated with contractors.
title: Pentagon Cuts Cost Forecast for Northrop Bomber by $2 Billion

description: Bank of England Deputy Governor Sarah Breeden signaled growing support for a digital pound, saying the central bank needs to maintain its grip on money to stop the risk of a collapse in confidence.
title: BOE’s Breeden Says Digital Pound Needed to Keep Grip on Money

description: Canada unveiled a new defense strategy that focuses on strengthening its military capabilities in the Arctic region, but its spending by the end of the decade will still be short of the 2% target set by the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.
title: Canada’s 2030 Defense Spending Plan Falls Short of NATO Target

description: Just months after enduring a firestorm over anti-Semitism, Elon Musk appeared to be courting another one when he amplified comments from a right-wing German extremist on the social media platform he owns.
title: Musk Magnifies Focus on Extremist Who Used Banned Nazi Slogan

description: Donald Trump’s social-media company just became the most valuable publicly traded client of an accounting firm that has more experience auditing companies traded over-the-counter and has had a string of regulatory issues, including a 100% deficiency rate on audits reviewed by a US watchdog.
title: Trump Media’s Accounting Firm Has History of Audit Deficiencies

description: A top House Republican is threatening to subpoena the Justice Department to determine whether the agency is investigating whether TikTok is violating US laws that require agents of foreign powers to register with the government.
title: TikTok Foreign Agent Designation Pressed by Key House Republican

description: Ukraine’s biggest energy company is looking to strike more deals with European gas traders to boost fuel storage this year, despite recent Russian attacks on its gas infrastructure.
title: Ukraine’s Naftogaz Courts Gas Traders After Russian Attacks

description: Germany’s ruling coalition will forge ahead this quarter with a sweeping overhaul of the nation’s armed forces with orders worth as much as €7 billion ($7.6 billion) for two navy frigates and hundreds of armored transport vehicles.
title: Germany to Order Ships, Armored Vehicles Worth Up to €7 Billion

description: South Africa has spent more than a year frustrating its biggest trade partner and largest foreign investor, the European Union, by failing to respond to requests for a high-level summit, according to people familiar with the situation.
title: South Africa Is Said to Irk EU With Indifference to Summit Calls

description: Janet Yellen got a respectful hearing in China in recent days for her main message — that Beijing’s manufacturing drive is a threat to other economies. But the warmth of her reception likely won’t translate into the policy shifts she wants.
title: China Has Too Much at Stake in Industry Push to Listen to Yellen

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has joined a growing list of European and US officials who have opened accounts on TikTok even as political pressure on the Chinese video-sharing app grows.
title: Scholz Late to TikTok Party as US Divestment Push Gathers Steam

description: Israel refrained from cutting interest rates on Monday, with the central bank focusing on heightening inflation expectations as the war in Gaza shakes the economy and defense spending surges.
title: Israel Holds Rates to Protect Shekel as War Spending Soars

description: Spain plans to end its so-called golden visa program for foreign property buyers in a bid to increase the amount of affordable housing available to locals.
title: Spain Joins Other EU Nations in Plan to End Golden Visas

description: Senior Israeli officials said progress has been made in negotiations for a cease-fire in Gaza that would include the release of hostages and Palestinian prisoners, a move that drew criticism from far-right ministers who threatened to bring down the government.
title: Israeli Officials Express Optimism Over Cease-Fire Talks With Hamas

description: Nigeria’s central bank offered to sell dollars to Bureaux de Change operators in the West African nation at a rate of 1,101 naira, according to a statement on its website, amid ongoing measures to stabilize the local currency.
title: Nigeria Central Bank Offers Dollars at 1,101 Naira to FX Bureaux

description: Former President Donald Trump said states should set any limits on abortion instead of calling for a national ban at any stage.
title: Trump Says States Should Set Abortion Limits, Notes Exceptions

description: Donald Trump’s newly public social media company is entangled in many legal cases, the bulk of them involving suspected misdeeds by the executives who helped set up the company and merge it with a public entity — and by the former president himself.
title: Why Trump’s Social Media Company Is Awash in Legal Cases

description: Switzerland aims to host a high-level Ukraine peace conference in mid-June with 80 to 100 nations mostly from the so-called Global South invited to attend, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Swiss Aim to Host Conference on Ukraine Peace Plan Mid-June

description: China’s automakers’ fast growth in electric cars follows innovation amid tough competition, the nation’s commerce minister said during a visit in Paris, rejecting the European Union’s probe into subsidies for the sector.
title: China Says Innovation Built EV Success, Rejects EU Subsidy Probe

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Chinese President Xi Won’t Back Down Against the West

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz will hold talks with Chinese President Xi Jinping in Beijing on April 16 as part of a four-day trip to China.
title: Scholz to Hold Talks Next Week With China’s Xi in Beijing

description: Congress has a lot left on its agenda this year, including bipartisan tax cuts that would benefit US companies with large capital expenditures and legislation to force TikTok’s Chinese parent company to sell its popular social video network.
title: Trains, Planes and TikTok: Congress Has a Lot to Do and Not Much Time

description: The Philippines said around 3,500 Filipino and American soldiers have started their annual joint training on its main Luzon island, a day after the allied nations held drills with Japan and Australia in the South China Sea.
title: US, Philippine Soldiers Train Ahead of Bigger Military Drills

description: President Joe Biden’s alternative student-debt relief plan could forgive loans for as many as 26 million Americans, a far-reaching initiative that will be tested by the same challenges that beset his original program struck down by the Supreme Court.
title: Biden Pursues Student-Debt Relief for About 26 Million Americans

description: China said it hasn’t sought to benefit from the fighting in Ukraine, comments that came as Russia’s top diplomat arrived in Beijing to discuss issues including the war.
title: China Says It Has Not, Will Not Seek to Gain From War in Ukraine

description: South Africa has asked companies to help it set up an office to facilitate the entry of private operators onto the continent’s biggest rail network for the first time.
title: South Africa Taps Business to Create Office to End Rail Monopoly

description: A free-trade agreement between Australia and the European Union would encourage closer ties on critical minerals at a crucial time for the energy transition, Europe’s Commissioner for Energy Kadri Simson said during a visit to Australia.
title: EU’s Simson Says FTA With Australia Would Help Minerals Push

description: The Bank of Israel is set for a close interest-rate call on Monday, with analysts almost evenly split between those predicting a cut to boost the war-damaged economy and those seeing monetary authorities keeping policy steady to protect the shekel.
title: Israel Faces Tough Call on Rates as War Clouds Economic Outlook

description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen wrapped up four days of talks in China with a warning to the country’s banks and exporters: If you help bolster Russia’s military capacity, Washington will come after you.
title: Yellen Threatens Sanctions for China Banks That Aid Russia’s War

description: Chinese tourists spent more per trip over a holiday than in 2019 for the first time since the pandemic started, adding to signs that consumption is recovering in the world’s No. 2 economy.
title: China Holiday Spending Rise Shows Consumption Recovery on Track

description: Mexico’s presidential candidates traded attacks and attempted to discredit each other in the first debate of the 2024 race, while going light on details of proposals to address corruption, education and health.
title: Mexico Candidates Squabble in First Debate Light on Proposals

description: Brazil Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes opened an inquiry into whether Elon Musk obstructed justice, escalating a spat with the billionaire over his social media platform X.
title: Brazil’s Top Justice Opens Criminal Inquiry Against Elon Musk

description: Ecuador’s President Daniel Noboa took a big gamble when he violated international rules by sending police to storm the Mexican embassy. So far, it’s paying off for him.
title: Ecuador’s President Gambles Mexico Embassy Raid Will Pay Off at Home

description: Australia’s supermarket giants could face millions of dollars in fines under a mandatory code of conduct recommended by an interim government review, the latest step to tackle a national cost-of-living crisis sparked by stubbornly high inflation.
title: Aussie Grocery Giants May Face Millions in Fines Under New Code
